alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 6:27AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...From 11 AM PDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations, especially burn scars. Some of the burned areas included in the Flood Watch are the Cedar Creek, Cub Creek, and Muckamuck burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Atmospheric conditions will favor slow moving thunderstorms capable of locally heavy rain this afternoon. Steep terrain and burn scars in Okanogan county will be particularly vulnerable to flash flooding. Runoff will be capable of producing rapid rises on creeks as well as producing rock and mud slides. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
